message.content: This question requires knowledge about ways to protect oneself from the flu. Option (A) is the correct answer because injecting oneself with deactivated elements of the illness is known as getting a flu vaccine. This helps to build immunity against the flu virus and reduces the chances of getting sick. Option (B) is incorrect because smallpox vaccine is not related to protecting against the flu. Option (C) is incorrect because injecting oneself with a healthy person's blood does not provide protection against the flu. Option (D) is incorrect because morphine is a painkiller and not a protective measure against the flu.

This question requires basic knowledge about vaccinations and how they protect against illnesses. To protect oneself from the flu when many others in the workplace are sick, the best option is to inject oneself with deactivated elements of the illness, also known as a flu vaccine. This stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies that can fight off the flu virus if exposed to it. Option (B) is incorrect because smallpox is a different illness and a smallpox vaccine would not protect against the flu. Option (C) is incorrect because injecting oneself with a healthy person's blood would not provide any protection against the flu. Option (D) is incorrect because morphine is a painkiller and does not provide any protection against the flu.
